sn2.18:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāketa in the deer park at the Añjana Wood.
sn2.18:1.3: Then, late at night, the glorious godling Kakudha, lighting up the entire Añjana Wood, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
sn2.18:1.8: “Well then, ascetic, do you neither delight nor sorrow?”
sn2.18:2.2: I hope that delight isn’t found in you.
sn2.18:2.4: overwhelm you as you sit alone.”
sn2.18:3.2: and no delight is found in me.
sn2.18:3.4: overwhelm me as I sit alone.”
sn2.18:4.2: How is delight not found in you?
sn2.18:4.4: overwhelm you as you sit alone?”
sn2.18:5.3: sir, you should know me as
sn2.18:5.4: a mendicant free of delight and gloom.”
sn2.18:6.3: A mendicant free of delight and gloom,
sn2.18:6.4: he has crossed over clinging to the world.”
